title: Moscow’s Continuing Ukrainian Buildup
description: Russia is continuing to surge military equipment and personnel near its border with Ukraine, and recent satellite imagery reveals increased activity from Russia's 144th Guards Motorized Rifle Division and the 41st Combined Arms Army.

title: Spotlighting Sustainability: Urban Tourism in Sub-Saharan Africa
description: What is urban tourism? Judd Devermont and Marielle Harris sit down with Regis Musavengane, Pius Siakwah, and Llewellyn Leonard to discuss why African governments should develop policies that reflect this distinct subset of tourism.

title: Techno-Authoritarianism: Platform for Repression in China and Abroad
description: Jonathan E. Hillman, director of the Reconnecting Asia Project and senior fellow with the Simon Chair in Political Economy, testifies before the Congressional-Executive Commission on China on the topic of “Techno-Authoritarianism: Platform for Repression in China and Abroad.”

title: The Shot Heard around the World
description: Vaccine diplomacy has never been more important. The United States has an opportunity to deploy its scientific and economic prowess in the service of all humanity. Yet, the United States has been slow to seize the opportunity while geopolitical rivals eagerly fill the gap.

title: U.S. Military Forces in FY 2022: Marine Corps
description: The Marine Corps continues a major restructuring to develop capabilities for great power conflict in the Pacific after two decades of conducting counterinsurgency operations ashore. The budget cuts units and personnel to pay for these new capabilities.

title: The Evening: Covid Pills Purchase, Polish Border Violence, I’ve Got a Feeling, and More
description: This edition of CSIS's nightly newsletter covers the Covid Pills Purchase, Polish Border Violence, I’ve Got a Feeling, and More.

title: After the AUKUS Crisis, Are France-U.S. Relations Back on Track?
description: If AUKUS unnecessarily eroded France-U.S. ties, Paris and Washington have managed to come out of this crisis rather quickly and to create the conditions for greater bilateral and transatlantic cooperation.

title: Authoritarian Nostalgia in Libya
description: Jon Alterman speaks with Robert Worth about authoritarian nostalgia in Libya.

title: WTO MC12 Agenda: Too Much or Not Enough?
description: The relevance of the WTO as the primary trade governance institution depends on the outcomes at the 12th Ministerial Conference. A new CQ from the Scholl Chair explores.

title: The Evening: Infrastructure Signed, Virtual China Summit, Night Train, and More
description: This edition of CSIS's nightly newsletter covers the Infrastructure Signed, Virtual China Summit, Night Train, and More.

title: Supporting Democratic Transitions Deserves a Prominent Role in Upcoming Summit for Democracy
description: With the upcoming Summit for Democracy, U.S. policymakers should rethink how to best support democratic transitions in light of backsliding in Sudan, Tunisia, and Myanmar.

title: Rotten Easter Eggs
description: In this week's column, the Scholl Chair analyzes the pending reconciliation bill and its Easter eggs in the energy and climate sections.
